TaxonIdentification.species_name: 小穗薹草 xiao sui tai cao

treatment.description: Rhizome with slender stolons. Culms 15–50 cm, triquetrous, rather thin, scabrous on upper part, clothed with yellowish brown and bladeless sheaths at base. Leaves equaling or slightly longer than culm, blades 2–4 mm wide, flat, sheathed. Involucral bracts leaflike, longer than spike, nearly not sheathed. Spikes 2–5; terminal 1–3 spikes male, approximate, linear or clavate, 1–3 cm, subsessile; remaining spikes female, remote, oblong, 1.5–2.5 × 0.7–0.8 cm, densely many flowered, pedunculate, lowermost peduncle 2–3 cm. Female glumes brown, ovate, 2.5–3 mm, membranous, costate, white hyaline on margin of apex, apex subacute. Utricles stramineous, slightly brown on upper part, obliquely patent, longer than glume, oblong-ovate, inflated trigonous, 4–4.5 mm, glabrous, slightly shiny, few veined, base rounded, apex gradually narrowed to a medium-sized beak, orifice emarginate. Nutlets rather loosely enveloped; style slender; stigmas 3, rather short. Fl. and fr. Jun–Aug.
treatment.distribution: Swamps, wet places at lakesides and riversides. Nei Mongol [Mongolia, Russia].
